title: Berkshire live: Monday 21 November - BBC News
summary: royal berkshire a & e redevelopment being discussed according to acting chief executive .
reading borough council may fine people who refuse to cut off engines when idling to reduce pollution .
reading fc are up to third in the championship .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for joining us today .
have a good evening .
we 'll be back at 08:00 gmt tomorrow .

documents.title: man arrested after shots fired in reading
text: we have been sent these photographs of catherine street in reading where police are investigating reports that gunshots were fired at around midnight .
a 24-year-old man has been arrested on sus of possessing a firearm .

documents.title: could a student from reading help us live in space ?
text: sam bass and his team have reached the finals of a global competition with the aim of improving our chances of existing on other planets .
he told bill buckley more about the 'lunar dome ' and what happens next

documents.title: eight more beds for royal berks a & e
text: despite opening a new a & e unit the royal berkshire hospital in reading is set to miss national performance targets this year .

text: fines proposal for 'vehicle idling '

documents.title: the legacy of 'back to sleep '
text: radio berkshire presenter anne diamond has been explaining her pride at how her family 's support was crucial in launching the 'back to sleep ' campaign , and the thousands of lives it has saved over the last twenty five years .

documents.title: a & e department 'not big enough to cope '
text: the acting chief executive of royal berkshire hospital says discussions are being held into redeveloping its a & e department .

documents.title: conservative councillor resigns over new homes plan
text: a councillor has resigned the conservative whip at wokingham borough council over plans to build more than 15,000 homes in grazeley .
councillor gary cowan said the proposals had been submitted to the government `` without the public or even members of this council being informed '' .
councillor cowan , who has been a conservative member for 20 years , said his decision was `` a matter of conscience '' .

documents.title: a loss which saved thousands of babies
text: twenty five years since the launch of the 'back to sleep ' campaign , mike hollingsworth , the ex-husband of bbc radio berkshire presenter anne diamond , retells the moment they realised their son sebastian had died .

text: royal berks : `` we 've had a really difficult year ''

documents.title: breakingshots fired in west reading
text: shots were fired in a west reading street at around midnight on sunday .
police have confirmed they were called to the address on catherine street and arrested a 24-year-old man on sus of possession of a firearm .
the man remains in custody at this time .
police are at the scene , whilst the investigation is ongoing .
police are appealing for anyone who saw a disturbance in catherine street last night to come forward and call 101 .

documents.title: stam staying 'realistic ' over promotion
text: reading boss jaap stam is staying realistic about championship promotion despite four wins in a row by his side .

documents.title: anne diamond 's courageous campaign to stop cot death
text: twenty-five years ago the bbc radio berkshire presenter anne diamond lost her baby son sebastian to cot death .
but out of that very public tragedy came a positive outcome .
her resulting campaign urging parents to put their babies to sleep on their backs has been credited with drastically reducing the number of sudden infant deaths in the uk .
you can hear more today on bbc radio berkshire at 10:00am .

documents.title: move the hospital ?
text: a redevelopment of the a & e department at the royal berkshire hospital is being considered as the acting chief executive admits it wo n't meet patient targets this year .
you have been texting us with your thoughts on the problem and the speculative idea of moving the hospital .
recently referred to rbh by gp to have x-rays for suspected fracture to wrist .
i went to x-ray dept who confirmed a break .
i was then taken to a & e to join back of the 30 minute queue just to be given a velcro splint which took 5 minutes .
did n't make much sense to me .
a new hospital out of town is not the answer .
the main number of people using rbh are elderly and have to travel by bus .
there 's an excellent bus service to the hospital local people do n't need to drive it 's just a bad habit .
you have to remember not everyone drives .
well done for actually getting someone from the royal berks to speak to you on your show !
does n't often happen .
going to a & e with coughs , colds , flu , etc , is it a generation thing ?
i 'm over 70 and we have never even thought about going to a & e for anything less than suspected broken bones , severe cuts or really strange , serious looking symptoms .
you can have your say on our twitter and facebook pages .

documents.title: the rail barriers are stuck down in thatcham
text: rail barriers down are stuck down in thatcham .
they will be in position until further notice engineers are on their way

documents.title: engines off please
text: reading borough council are proposing a scheme to fine people for leaving their engines running .
in parts of central london , the scheme is already operating , with talks about a £ 40 fine being issued in reading for those caught idling .

the environment minister therese coffey has questioned reading council 's efforts to reduce air pollution in the town and reading council 's regulatory services manager , james crosbie says people who refuse to cut their engines will face fines .

documents.title: trains between reading and london paddington are delayed this morning
text: delays of 13 minutes on london paddington trains leaving reading
something going on at thatcham crossing ?
barriers not been raised for a very long time

documents.title: redevelopment of royal berkshire hospital a & e 'under discussion '
text: the active chief executive of royal berkshire hospital .
has said the town 's a & e department is dealing with almost twice the number of visits it was originally expected to meet and now needs to be redeveloped .

mary sherry says despite eight new beds being made available for this winter the casualty department is not meeting its target of treating 95 % of patients within four hours , and it wo n't be able to in the coming months .
the clinical chair of the windsor & maidenhead clinical commissioning group , dr adrian hayter is urging people to go elsewhere for help first .

documents.title: localised flooding and persistent rain in berkshire
text: there 's a deep area of low pressure over berkshire .
a warning is in place about localised flooding and difficult driving conditions .
there will be strong gusts of wind and heavy showers this afternoon .
find out more on the bbc website .

text: morning , it 's a wet and rainy day .
we 'll be keeping you updated throughout the day with the latest weather , travel and news from berkshire on our brand new live news service .
you can stay in touch on our twitter and facebook pages .
